title: [Large-scale] Project Utilizing Transfer Learning and Bayesian Optimization for Biological Sequence Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational molecular biology, statistical analysis, and basic machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Learners undertake a project applying transfer learning and Bayesian optimization techniques to solve real-world biological sequence optimization problems. Collaboration using digital devices and experimental data analysis are emphasized.

learning_goals: Learners can construct an experimental design workflow for sharing information between similar biological sequences using a transfer learning model.
Learners can reduce the number of experiments required for biological sequence development by at least 30% using Bayesian optimization.
Learners can explain cross-validation methods to evaluate model prediction performance through practical cases like DNA competitor sequence optimization.
Learners can select appropriate optimization strategies for biological applications by comparing single-objective and penalty optimization tasks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
